text: Reading this article I see that I fall into the category of the 10% most frequent flyers in England who count for  more than half of all international flights in 2018.   I need to retire soon as my carbon footprint is embarrassing 😣
Also food is the most basic need so the count/pay for carbon should also be linked to the nutritional value of the food and a person's RDA.

Yes in order to pay u must 1st count and I fully agree the carbon cost should be embedded on the product ie the consumer counts/pays not what we have in Agriculture atm where we count/pay as a consumer and producer.
Hi Philip coulc you tell us who do you think should count the carbon the producer or the consumer

It would be of greater benefit as it would be for journalists and academics to actually go walk on a farm measure how much grass (carbon) is converted to food, dig a hole look for worms, walk over to the hedgerow and count birds, small mammals, insects  Ah but the Internet said🤯
There is a electricity  plant in Ireland which gets its wood from the US 3500 miles away...That is seen as sustainable biomass and does not count to Ireland's carbon footprint...

Doesn't count as far as farming is concerned. Carbon credit given to energy sector. Not any of these beauties found in Co. Mercia forests!! . Hedgerows don't count either apparently. Otherwise, fine example of what must be done.
